text: Indonesia's Transport Minister looking
through the recovered wreckage of the
crashed AirAsia plane as news was
confirmed of the second black box being
retrieved the cockpit voice recorder
contains vital information about the
conversations between the pilot and the
co-pilot minutes before the crash this
is a major breakthrough for Indonesia
officials have now found two vital parts
of the wreckage
that will help piece together a picture
of why the plane crashed on Monday the
flight data recorder was retrieved from
the depths of the Java Sea both boxes
will now be sent to labs in Indonesia
for analysis
it's thought international investigators
will also be pitching in the black box
will be saved at the laboratory and
people are not allowed to enter unless
assigned by the investigating team the
black box remain in the container until
we have agreed on the standard procedure
to openers the crash has cast an ugly
shadow on Indonesia's growing airline
industry the investigator must be open
with the results on what went wrong was
a human error of the problems I think
must be transparent
first of all security and safety as well
as other aviation regulations must be
enhanced among the pilots they should be
retrained with an emphasis on safety
it's now been more than two weeks since
the AirAsia plane plunged into the Java
Sea killing all 162 people on board the
discovery of the two black boxes will be
a welcome development for relatives
waiting for any answers as to why the
plane crashed and will hopefully provide
some closure for these grieving families
Karishma Vaswani BBC news jakarta
